page.title: 12TATENHILL AIRFIELD
page.content:
Although called{Tatenhill Airfield,}it is not in the neighbouring village of Tatenhill but{in Needwood.} It was an active airbase during the 1939-40 war.
{Part}of it is still used as a{private {airfield}by a national brewery based in Burton-on-Trent, and{Her Majesty {Queen Elizabeth II}left from it when she visited the Duchy of Lancaster estates in the early 1980s.
However{much}of it is{now derelict. In one area{"banger" racing}takes place at weekends; another area is used by a local club to fly{model {aeroplanes;}and in another part{sheep {graze}on the now broken runways. The buildings too are now derelict, used only by the sheep to shelter from the winter winds.
